title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
Enygma` left at 00:32 (Ping timeout: 272 seconds  
neruda joined #xwiki at 01:01  
neruda - (01:01): hello  
neruda - (01:01): im test driving the latest standalone install for windows  
neruda - (01:02): can i only CRUD content inside the "sandbox" section?  
sburjan` - (01:07): well, do you need to do something more ?  
sburjan` - (01:07): in thet Page ?  
sburjan` - (01:08): that  
neruda - (01:08): i just need a wiki that i can install on a windows box for local use only  
neruda - (01:08): i saw the standalone install and thought "perfect!"  
neruda - (01:09): am i being way too lazy?  
sburjan` - (01:09): no  
sburjan` - (01:09): basically you can edit everyything you want within  
neruda - (01:09): and for backup purposes where will HSQL store the data/  
sburjan` - (01:10): as far as I know, HSQL stores it in a file  
sburjan` - (01:11): HSQL is just an embedded database .. it's NOT recommended for production environment.. because dbase tends to get very large to store it in a single file  
sburjan` - (01:11): you can set your xwiki to use mysql or orher dbases if you need  
neruda - (01:11): yeah this is for single user/local/personal use only  
sburjan` - (01:11): \*other  
neruda - (01:11): i just want a way to organize my notes on different things  
neruda - (01:12): i thought a wiki would be perfect  
sburjan` - (01:12): well.. what you downloaded can be used for production if you change the default database  
neruda - (01:12): i have very few needs  
sdumitriu - (01:12): neruda: There should be a "database" folder inside the folder where XWiki was installed  
sdumitriu - (01:12): That's all you need to backup  
neruda - (01:12): sdumitriu: thx!  
sdumitriu - (01:12): neruda: Whay do you mean only in the sandbox section?  
sdumitriu - (01:13): Did you log in?  
neruda - (01:13): sdumitriu: the heading on the sandbox section says: The sandbox is a part of your wiki that you can freely modify. It's meant to let you practice editing.  
neruda - (01:13): yes im logged in  
sdumitriu - (01:14): Well then you can edit anything  
neruda - (01:14): i thought that meant that other sections would not persist changes  
neruda - (01:14): ok  
neruda - (01:14): understood  
sburjan` - (01:14): everything persists  
sburjan` - (01:14): :)  
neruda - (01:14): good  
sburjan` - (01:14): hello sdumitriu :)  
sdumitriu - (01:14): No, it means that you can do whatever you want in the sandbox space, it's not supposed to hold valuable information, it's there just for practice  
sdumitriu - (01:15): Hi sburjan`  
neruda - (01:15): sdumitriu: ok i misinterpreted  
neruda - (01:16): one other thing: in vista the start\_xwiki shortcut placed on the desktop after installation does not work  
lpereira left at 01:16 (Quit: Leaving.  
neruda - (01:16): even when set to run as admin the window closes automatically when it should stay open  
sburjan` - (01:17): hmmm  
neruda - (01:17): stop\_xwiki works fine thought  
neruda - (01:17): though  
sburjan` - (01:17): try orunning start\_xwiki within a command prompt  
sburjan` - (01:17): \*running  
sburjan` - (01:17): and tell us what's the error message you get there  
neruda - (01:17): sburjan`: that does work, thats what im doing now  
neruda - (01:18): the problem is vista automatically closes the window on batch files when the process needs it to stay open  
neruda - (01:18): ive been fighting with it for a while, but i gave up and now just execute start\_xwiki from the cmdline  
sburjan` - (01:18): that's odd  
sburjan` - (01:19): that's odd. I've seen people using xwiki and starting it succesfully double clicking on the file. and the window remains open  
neruda - (01:19): hmmm  
sburjan` - (01:19): on vista and 7 too  
neruda - (01:20): sburjan: i wonder...  
sburjan` - (01:20): I'm sure of it.. I've seen it with my own eyes  
neruda - (01:21): ok  
sburjan` - (01:21): the window should persist  
neruda - (01:21): i should prob stop being lazy and migrate to 7  
sburjan` - (01:21): no, this must work on vista too  
neruda - (01:21): are you on a win box?  
sburjan` - (01:22): now yes, but it;s a 7  
sburjan` - (01:26): did you tried this on other ms os'es ?  
neruda - (01:26): ok, the first thing i should do is create a space for my data correct?  
neruda - (01:26): sburjan`no  
sburjan` - (01:27): well .. you can organize you data into spaces  
sburjan` - (01:27): that is the recommended approach  
sburjan` - (01:27): but this depends on you  
sburjan` - (01:27): to group the content  
neruda - (01:27): sburjan`:  ok  
neruda - (01:27): spaces can contain spaces?  
sburjan` - (01:28): no  
neruda - (01:28): ok good to know  
sburjan` - (01:28): as far as I know, they can't  
neruda - (01:28): articles in different spaces can link to each other without a problem?  
sburjan` - (01:28): yes, of course  
neruda - (01:29): ok just asking to be careful  
neruda - (01:29): are there any spaces i can remove since this wiki is single user only?  
sburjan` - (01:30): it's not single user .. you can add as many users you want  
sburjan` - (01:30): with rights too .. rights on global , space, and page  
neruda - (01:30): i know, i just want to emphasize that i will be the only user  
neruda - (01:30): and since there will be only one user are there any spaces that are not needed?  
sburjan` - (01:30): oh.. well ... there are spaces that are used by some applications  
sburjan` - (01:31): i'd recommend not to delete any sapces  
sburjan` - (01:31): \*spaces  
sburjan` - (01:31): I guess you want to customiza your main page  
sburjan` - (01:31): \*customize  
neruda - (01:32): yeah  
sburjan` - (01:32): the best way is to edit the page, and remove the space reference so it won't be displayed  
sburjan` - (01:33): not to actually delete the space  
neruda - (01:37): sburjan`: ok thx  
neruda - (01:37): lemme try that  
sdumitriu left at 01:37 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
neruda - (01:38): sburjan`: im customizing view/Xwiki or view/Main?  
sburjan` - (01:43): view/Main  
sburjan` - (01:43): main is the first page  
sburjan` - (01:45): do you want to remove the Sandbox from homepage?
